titlestmt.titleproper: Southern Medical Society of Philadelphia cartes de visites 1868
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Southern Medical Society of Philadelphia cartes de visites

bioghist.p: The Southern Medical Society of Philadelphia was organized in 1866. Members practiced or resided south of Market street and east of the Schuylkill River.

scopecontent.p: This is an album of cabinet card photographs ("cartes de visites") of notable physicians. Includes images of William Pepper, David Hayes Agnew, Hugh Lenox Hodge, Joseph Leidy, Alfred Still√©; Andrew Smiley; William Savage, and Robert Penrose. Also includes one photograph of an unknown building, possibly the Southern Medical Society.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
